conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the reciprocal of velocity (1/v) as a function of displacement (x) to determine whether the particle is accelerating or decelerating.
The graph shows a linear relationship between 1/v (y-axis) and x (x-axis). Two points, A and B, are marked on the graph corresponding to different values of x and 1/v.
The graph indicates that the value of 1/v increases from point A to point B.
An increase in 1/v from point A to point B implies that the particle's velocity is decreasing in this interval.
The graph indicates that the value of 1/v decreases from point B to point C.
A decrease in 1/v from point B to point C implies that the particle's velocity is increasing in this interval.
From point A to point B, the particle is decelerating, and from point B to point C, the particle is accelerating.
The correct answer is that the particle is accelerating.
